text: At a time when the dominant culture peddles an attenuated, impoverished, and ostensibly depoliticised version of reality, the work of cognitive mapping has never been more crucial.

The shifting totality of the capitalist world system can only be grasped in a series of (connected) fragments: interconnection, after all, is the other side of structural incompleteness. Foreign to individual experience, such structures are accessible only by cognition.

Jameson maintained that "the various modernisms" arose from the aesthetic difficulties and representational impasses posed by the opacity of global capitalism, that it is only the counterintuitive forms of art and theory that can provide viable maps of the contours of capitalism.
